page.title: 07Bournville Alms Houses
page.content: Bournville Alms Houses are on Maryvale Road. They were built in 1898 by {Richard Cadbury.}They are beautifully cared for with leaded windows and flowers on the window sills. The Alms Houses are 33 bungalows built around a quadrangle. They were built for old people whose accomodation is unsatisfactory but who are able to look after themselves. People who have worked at{Cadbury Schweppes}and are aged between 60 and 80 years can apply for an Alms House and widows or widowers of Cadbury Schweppes workers are also considered. To apply for one of the bungalows they have to contact the{Bournville Village Trust}in Oak Tree Lane. There is a{warden}who is in charge of the well-being of the residents and lives in the quadrangle.
